snippet: An appeals panel struck down a judge’s order that New York State transfer thousands of mentally ill adults in New York City from institutional group homes into their own homes and apartments.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals strikes down a judge’s order that New York State transfer thousands of mentally ill adults in New York City from institutional group homes into what is known as supportive housing, in which patients live alone but continue to receive treatment and services; ruling brings a nine-year legal battle to an abrupt end without resolving the underlying issues of how the state cares for such patients.
lead_paragraph: An appeals panel struck down a judge’s order that New York State transfer thousands of mentally ill adults in New York City from institutional group homes into their own homes and apartments.

headline.seo: Order on Housing Mentally Ill Adults in New York City Is Struck Down
headline.main: Court Upends 9-Year Fight on Housing Mentally Ill
